Text.Value: R-really?
She tried to kill me, for one.
Who said?
Uh...
I hope you were hibernating, little cub. I can't think of another reason you wouldn't come down to say hello.
No matter, boy. I have another here. And I won't find the place disturbed at all, will I?

EditorData.NodeContext: tongue in cheek, not actually mad at the child, just making him sweat for playing where he shouldn't

Text.Value: Jaheira! I d-didn't... didn't w-want to see. If you were r-really dead. They said...
My Harper pin. Was a certain little sneak-thief playing down in my sanctuary?
I fought alongside a warrior angel.
Never planning on letting that go, are you?
I freed a pixie from a magic lamp. She was awful.
Ah. My Harper pin? You had it for safe-keeping, I trust? Not to, say, play down in my sanctuary?

EditorData.NodeContext: tongue in cheek, not actually mad at the child, just making him sweat for playing where he shouldn't

Text.Value: We broke the curse that had gripped Moonrise Towers for a century.
Jord and Rion. They didn't think I c-could hear...
One of the perils of travelling with Jaheira.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: A bit different to the OOM one - might be better to unify.

Text.Value: Well, it doesn't matter. Because coming home is the best part.
The very same. We can give that one a happy ending after all.
N-no.
Wait - here. I was... keeping this. Safe.
Ignore my friend. He hit his head very very hard. He is in danger of it happening again.
Ignore my friend. She hit her head very very hard. She is in danger of it happening again.
Ignore my friend. They hit their head very very hard. They are in danger of it happening again.
I faced a god of death and won.
Bloodshed. Death. More of the same.
No, cub, he does not mean me.
No, cub, she does not mean me.
No, cub, they do not mean me.
Moonrise...? Like the place from your s-stories, Jaheira?
Wait, I - I had your pin. But I th-think I... lost it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Casting around to give Jaheira her pin, realising he's lost it. Stutter re-emerging as he realizes he might be in trouble - not actually afraid, just sheepish.

Text.Value: Really?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: A bit different to the OOM one - might be better to unify.

Text.Value: Now, cub. Solitude is a wonderful thing, but not too much. Come downstairs and fight with your sisters.
Yes, you liar. Why this need for tall tales?
Liar. That was Jaheira, years ago.
Shrug.
You little sneak-thief. Well, they were wrong - look. Not dead. I just... had a few adventures. Like...

Synopsis: COM for Jaheira and Jaheira's grandson with player near, a timid and frightened little boy who's brave on the inside but his cousins tease him because he gets scared easily, his cowardly-but-brave behaviour is all a setup for Jaheira to have a sweet little moment where she can have a nice little cathartic nod to Khalid and encourage the kid, because she believes in him, and leads to a moment where the player can contextualise this into her current dilemma - She was quick to determine that he was gone, but that was in her headstrong days when all was more...black and white. Now she has these doubts on whether she should be even considering having her life pace slowed by rite of simply being a strong druid or not.
